results.title: The Bargain
results.creator_credit: Beryl Stevens, Film Producers Guild and W.M. Larkins Studio
results.brief_description: An animated film on how to buy a steam roller without enough ready money. The intending purchaser is shown the advantages of everyday banking and the services offered by the modern bank to its customer. Designed to convince the ordinary wage earner that it is sensible for several reasons to have a current account with a bank.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Beryl Stevens, Film Producers Guild and W.M. Larkins Studio

results.title: The Bamboo Curtain Falls
results.brief_description: This is the second part of a two part documentary that looks at the mysterious story of Tibet. It is the story about a country unseen by Europeans until early this century, of its destruction by invading Chinese in 1950, and the flight into India of the Dalai Lama with 100,000 Tibetans.

results.title: The Bakhtiari migration
results.creator_credit: Anthony Howarth, David Koff, Anthony-David Productions and Films Incorporated
results.brief_description: An excellent record of one of the most hazardous feats of human endurance still undertaken. Shows the way in which half a million people together with millions of valuable sheep, goats, mules and dogs, struggle for five weeks to make the two hundred mile crossing of the Zagros mountains, South Iran.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Anthony Howarth, David Koff, Anthony-David Productions and Films Incorporated

results.title: The Back strokes
results.brief_description: A film made for the Amateur Swimming Association demonstrating the old and new methods of leg and arm action for this stoke, including a detailed comparison of bent and straight arm recovery. Photographed by G. Pocknall.

results.title: The Baby Boomers' Picture Show
results.creator_credit: Stephen Ramsey, ABC-TV (Australia) and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Inspired by the book “Baby Boomers” by Helen Townsend, “The Baby Boomers’ Picture Show” re-creates the sensations, the thrills and the horrors of growing up in Australia in the 1950’s and 1960’s.
results.description: Inspired by the book “Baby Boomers” by Helen Townsend, “The Baby Boomers’ Picture Show” re-creates the sensations, the thrills and the horrors of growing up in Australia in the 1950’s and 1960’s.

results.title: The Awakening
results.creator_credit: Ron Tanner, Peter Griffiths, Lloyds Bank and Millbank Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Starting your own business”.
This is the second film in the series, Starting Your Own Business. The film continues the story of the three people who are self-employed, and it traces the first year in business for each of the characters. Again the problems and pitfalls involved in going it alone are identified and the audience can see the reasons why two of the businesses fail.

results.title: The Aviator's generosity
results.creator_credit: Ingvald Oes, Great Northern Film Company and Nordisk Films Kompagni
results.brief_description: The love of two men for the same woman is resolved by the generous nature of one man. Silent film with music soundtrack.

results.title: The Automated mariner
results.creator_credit: Roger Lupton, Damien Parer and Tasmanian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Demonstrates how radar, sonar, and echosound are used to catch the variety of edible sealife found around the coast of Tasmania. Narrated by Frank Bansel, music performed by the Tasmanian Symphony Orchestra conducted by Pinchas Steinberg.

results.title: The Austrian Tyrol
results.brief_description: Famed for its natural beauty and alpine grandeur, the Austrian Tyrol has excellent mountain roads for enjoyable walks or mountain climbing. The film shows some of the villages including the 700 years old city of Innsbruck nestling below the vast mountains.

results.title: The Australian Review: Australian show-time
results.brief_description: A crowd arrives at the showground aboard a ‘Red Rattler’ to experience the recreational and agricultural highlights of Melbourne’s Agricultural Show. Narrated by John Masters.
